abstract: Two former executives at the computer maker Gateway were found liable on civil claims that they manipulated financial results to meet Wall Street expectations in 2000, the Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday. The verdicts against Gateway’s former chief financial officer, John J. Todd, and the former controller, Robert D. Manza, were announced by a federal jury in San Diego after a three-week trial, the S.E.C. said.
lead_paragraph: Two former executives at the computer maker Gateway were found liable on civil claims that they manipulated financial results to meet Wall Street expectations in 2000, the Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday. The verdicts against Gateway’s former chief financial officer, John J. Todd, and the former controller, Robert D. Manza, were announced by a federal jury in San Diego after a three-week trial, the S.E.C. said.

headline.main: Ex-Gateway Officers Found Liable in Trial
